text:
As Prime Minister, I am determined to do what it takes to secure our NHS for the future so it is there for all of us.
 
This is personal for me. Just like millions of people across our country, I rely on the NHS every day.https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-6350511/The-Tories-natural-party-NHS-writes-PRIME-MINISTER-THERESA-MAY.html …

html: Lord Heywood worked tirelessly to serve our country in the finest traditions of the Civil Service and he is a huge loss to British public life. html: We're helping people keep more of what they earn by: Raising the personal allowance to £12,500. Saving a typical basic rate taxpayer £1,205 a year compared to 2010. Keeping our promise on income tax one year early. #Budget2018pic.twitter.com/GO2QwezO38
text:
We're helping people keep more of what they earn by:
 
 Raising the personal allowance to £12,500.
 Saving a typical basic rate taxpayer £1,205 a year compared to 2010.
 Keeping our promise on income tax one year early.
 
 #Budget2018pic.twitter.com/GO2QwezO38

html: We held a people’s vote, it was the referendum in 2016. It is now a matter of trust in politicians that we should deliver on the will of the British people. That’s why I’m calling on Labour to rule out a second referendum and not take us back to square one.pic.twitter.com/p98HbTeNZE
text:
We held a people’s vote, it was the referendum in 2016. It is now a matter of trust in politicians that we should deliver on the will of the British people.

That’s why I’m calling on Labour to rule out a second referendum and not take us back to square one.pic.twitter.com/p98HbTeNZE

Putting our weight behind Heathrow’s expansion.

#PMQs

#PMQs

html: Since 2010 we've invested in our NHS meaning there are: 14,900 more doctors. 13,200 more nurses on our wards.  5,000 extra nurse training places available from September 2018. A record number of undergraduates beginning medical training by 2020. #PMQs
text:
Since 2010 we've invested in our NHS meaning there are:

 14,900 more doctors.
 13,200 more nurses on our wards. 
 5,000 extra nurse training places available from September 2018.
 A record number of undergraduates beginning medical training by 2020.

#PMQs

html: Four big things next week: 2 million people on the National Living wage will get a pay rise 31 million workers will get an income tax cut 12 million pensioners will get a boost to their state pension Millions of drivers will see fuel duty frozen again #PMQs
text:
Four big things next week:

 2 million people on the National Living wage will get a pay rise
 31 million workers will get an income tax cut 
 12 million pensioners will get a boost to their state pension
 Millions of drivers will see fuel duty frozen again

#PMQs

html: Whilst we’ve committed £1 billion through to 2020 to tackle rough sleeping and homelessness, we know it’s not only about money. That's why we’re changing how councils approach this issue to help more people get tailored support sooner when they’re at risk of homelessness. #PMQs
text: Whilst we’ve committed £1 billion through to 2020 to tackle rough sleeping and homelessness, we know it’s not only about money. That's why we’re changing how councils approach this issue to help more people get tailored support sooner when they’re at risk of homelessness. #PMQs

html: We pledged in our manifesto to halve rough sleeping by 2022 and eliminate it altogether by 2027. We’ve already committed £1 billion to help bring this about, and are piloting the Housing First approach in three of our great cities. #PMQs

html: The #GoodWork plan, in response to #TaylorReview means: All workers now have a right to a payslip A right to a contract on day one for all A crack down on using unpaid interns to do the job of a worker https://www.gov.uk/government/news/millions-to-benefit-from-enhanced-rights-as-government-responds-to-taylor-review-of-modern-working-practices …pic.twitter.com/9SHeHfz0jS
text:
The #GoodWork plan, in response to #TaylorReview means:

 All workers now have a right to a payslip
 A right to a contract on day one for all
 A crack down on using unpaid interns to do the job of a worker

html: I want to see more women entering Parliament. I would say to any woman that does, be yourself, don't feel you've got to judge yourself by male stereotype, be yourself and believe what you're doing - because you can make a real difference to other people's lives. #Vote100pic.twitter.com/pW68WtCwPm

text: We have taken enormous strides as a society, and must continue to protect our democracy and ensure social media is a force for good in public life, with a series of new steps – PM on #Vote100 #StillMarching #100yearspic.twitter.com/o3B2eiCBJ8

html: .@Theresa_May: "Each day in Downing Street when I pass the framed portraits of my 53 predecessors, 52 of whom were men, I focus not on what I can say but on what I can do to make our country a better place". #Vote100
text: .@Theresa_May: "Each day in Downing Street when I pass the framed portraits of my 53 predecessors, 52 of whom were men, I focus not on what I can say but on what I can do to make our country a better place". #Vote100

html: .@Theresa_May: "At its best, British public life is characterised by the values which we have traditionally been most proud of as a nation. Fierce rivalry, yes, but also common decency. A rejection of extremism and absolutism". #Vote100
text: .@Theresa_May: "At its best, British public life is characterised by the values which we have traditionally been most proud of as a nation. Fierce rivalry, yes, but also common decency. A rejection of extremism and absolutism". #Vote100

html: .@Theresa_May: "To address this challenge to our public debate, we will launch a review to examine the sustainability of our national and local press. A free press is one of the foundations on which our democracy is built and it must be preserved". #Vote100
text: .@Theresa_May: "To address this challenge to our public debate, we will launch a review to examine the sustainability of our national and local press. A free press is one of the foundations on which our democracy is built and it must be preserved". #Vote100

html: .@Theresa_May: "Over 200 local papers have closed since 2005. This is dangerous for our democracy. When trusted and credible news sources decline, we can become vulnerable to news which is untrustworthy". #Vote100
text: .@Theresa_May: "Over 200 local papers have closed since 2005. This is dangerous for our democracy. When trusted and credible news sources decline, we can become vulnerable to news which is untrustworthy". #Vote100

html: .@Theresa_May: "Changes in technology are having a profound impact on one of the cornerstones of our public debate – our free press. Good quality journalism provides us with the information and analysis we need to inform our viewpoints and conduct a genuine discussion". #Vote100
text: .@Theresa_May: "Changes in technology are having a profound impact on one of the cornerstones of our public debate – our free press. Good quality journalism provides us with the information and analysis we need to inform our viewpoints and conduct a genuine discussion". #Vote100

html: .@Theresa_May: "In our universities, which should be bastions of free thought and expression, we have seen the efforts of politicians and academics to engage in open debate frustrated by an aggressive and intolerant minority". #Vote100pic.twitter.com/dOgZZoJ4uz
text: .@Theresa_May: "In our universities, which should be bastions of free thought and expression, we have seen the efforts of politicians and academics to engage in open debate frustrated by an aggressive and intolerant minority". #Vote100pic.twitter.com/dOgZZoJ4uz

html: .@Theresa_May: "We will take action to make our electoral process more robust and offer greater protections for people taking part in elections. While intimidation is already a crime, we will consult on making it an offence in law to intimidate candidates". #Vote100
text: .@Theresa_May: "We will take action to make our electoral process more robust and offer greater protections for people taking part in elections. While intimidation is already a crime, we will consult on making it an offence in law to intimidate candidates". #Vote100

html: .@Theresa_May: ‘My Party has already put in place a new code of conduct which puts respect and decency at its core. We have proposed that the other parties follow us in signing a #RespectPledge for all campaigning. I hope that they will take us up on that suggestion.’ #Vote100
text: .@Theresa_May: ‘My Party has already put in place a new code of conduct which puts respect and decency at its core. We have proposed that the other parties follow us in signing a #RespectPledge for all campaigning. I hope that they will take us up on that suggestion.’ #Vote100

html: .@Theresa_May: ‘Social media – which can and should be a force for good in our democracy – are being exploited and abused, often anonymously. British democracy has always been robust and oppositional. But a line is crossed when disagreement mutates into intimidation.’ #Vote100
text: .@Theresa_May: ‘Social media – which can and should be a force for good in our democracy – are being exploited and abused, often anonymously. British democracy has always been robust and oppositional. But a line is crossed when disagreement mutates into intimidation.’ #Vote100

html: .@Theresa_May: ‘Today, the ideal of a truly plural and open public sphere where everyone can take part is in danger. A tone of bitterness and aggression has entered into our public debate.’ #Vote100

The NHS was better prepared for winter than ever before – we invested an extra £437m and the system planned ahead, but of course it’s the staff who make the difference.

html: Thank you to the NHS staff who work hard and do a fantastic job for us day in and day out all year round. text:
Friday's agreement is good news for people who voted Leave, who were worried we were so bogged down in tortuous negotiations it was never going to happen.

And it is good news for people who voted Remain, who were worried we were going to crash out without a deal.pic.twitter.com/8RkhD07kmI

html: Today’s Brexit deal delivers: - No hard border in Northern Ireland - Secures a good financial deal for British taxpayers meaning more money for our priorities like housing, schools, and the NHS - Secured the rights of EU citizens living here, and UK citizens living in the EUpic.twitter.com/h4QtXdwnFv
text:
Today’s Brexit deal delivers:
- No hard border in Northern Ireland
- Secures a good financial deal for British taxpayers meaning more money for our priorities like housing, schools, and the NHS
- Secured the rights of EU citizens living here, and UK citizens living in the EUpic.twitter.com/h4QtXdwnFv
